DOC.brief_title: Glucose Control eMPC Algorithm Peri- Postoperative Period Cardiac Surgery Patients
DOC.detailed_description: Context . Increased blood glucose level frequently occur critically ill patient normalization intensive insulin treatment markedly improve clinical outcome . Objective Design : Randomized control trial compare blood glucose control model predictive control algorithm variable sample rate ( eMPC ) routine glucose management protocol ( RMP ) peri- postoperative period cardiac surgery patient . Setting : Department Cardiac Surgery , University Hospital . Patients . 60 cardiac surgery patient . Interventions . Elective cardiac surgery treatment continuous insulin infusion maintain euglycemia ( target range 4.4 – 6.1 mmol/l ) . 30 patient randomize eMPC 30 RMP treatment . Blood glucose measure 1-4 hour interval depend request algorithm surgery post-operation period 24 hour . Main Outcome Measures . Mean blood glucose , percentage time target range . Results . Mean blood glucose 6.15 ± 1.11 mmol/l eMPC vs. 7.21 ± 1.08 mmol/l RMP group ( p < 0.05 ) ; percentage time target range 60.4 ± 22.8 % eMPC vs. 27.5 ± 16.2 % RMP group ( p < 0.05 ) . No severe hypoglycemia ( blood glucose bellow 2.9 mmol/l ) observe study . Average insulin infusion rate 4.67 ± 3.34 eMPC vs. 2.57 ± 1.66 IU/h RMP ( p < 0.05 ) , average sample interval 1.46 ± 0.31 vs. 2.10 ± 0.22 hour ( p < 0.05 ) . Conclusions . eMPC algorithm effective comparably safe compare RMP maintain euglycemia cardiac surgery patient .
